title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in the BIRT report designer and entering an invalid date string in the 'default value' field, such as '55/66/9999', the invalid value is accepted and the following definition shows up in the report design:
EB: The BIRT report designer should reject invalid date/time strings and display an error message.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Verify that the invalid value is accepted and the definition shows up in the report design.
